args:
Marley wants Sylas to play the other main
character in his production. Though he uses
Laxi for forceful methods of convincing him,
he finally admits that he's putting on the play
to save his ill sister. Learning this, Sylas
eventually agrees to take part.
I put this costume on, but I'm still not\ncertain why I'm wearing it if I'm just\nstanding in for this rehearsal.
You are handsome, Sylas.\n▷Yeah, you look great!◁
And right they are! The fragile and\nneurotic air about you works even\nbetter than I had imagined!

For you see, Dr. Schmidt is a scientist
who created the clockwork creature, Fran,
in an attempt to resurrect his late wife,
Carol—and you fit him to a T!
Having you be a mere stand-in is a waste.\nI want you to take the stage for real!
Thank you, but, um...no. I have no desire\nto seize the spotlight in such a way.
Please, you must! If I don't find someone\nto play Dr. Schmidt in the next three days,\nthe play will be canceled!
And now we see the real reason you had\nme try on that costume. Well, apologies,\nbut I'm still not interested.
If you think staring at me is going to make\nme bend, you have another thing coming.
Oh, I was hoping flattery might work.\nHe's perfect for my play! Utterly perfect!\nI've had my eye on him this whole time!
You are a jerk, Sylas.\n▷C'mon, Laxi. He doesn't have to\nbe in the show if he doesn't want to.◁
No! I refuse to move on! Out of all the\nactors who have traipsed through my door,\nhe is perfect for Schmidt! Perfect, I say!
This play needs Sylas! Can't you help us\nsomehow, Laxi?
I will ensure your story is completed.
Thank you so much. In that case,\nI have a plan...
(I came here to fulfill a client's request,\nand now they're attempting to force\nme into some stage production!)
This is what happens when you let\nyour guard down. People just...
Affirmative. And I will continue to be in\nyour way until you agree to be my partner.\nThose are Marley's orders.
Well, you're wasting your time.\nWalk away, Laxi.
▷He's getting angry just like Marley\nsaid he would! Now's your chance!◁\nUnderstood.
I apologize, Sylas. It seems I have\npushed you too far. Sniff.
Uh, what's going on here? Are you\nmalfunctioning or something?\nWhy did you just say ＂sniff＂?
Sob. All I want is to perform with you,\nSylas. It is all I ever wanted. Sob sob.
...Look, if you're trying to act here,\nit's REALLY not working.

Incomprehensible. How did you know
I was acting?
▷Because it was obvious! You can't win
someone over with acting like that.◁
Hmm. Well, I am not giving up. I will have\na new scenario from Marley soon.

Sylas, you are so handsome and smart
and amazing. If you were to stand on
stage with me, I might even fall in love
with you. Swoon.
Tell Marley that I will not be swayed\nby the affections of his leading lady.
A toast to Sylas. Let us fill our glasses\nwith dreams of the stage upon which\nwe will perform together. Huzzah.
Flash mobs aren't even in style anymore.
Oh no. I am going to be late.
Ouch. That hurt. Look where you\nare walking next time, mister.\nAlso, come be in the play with me.
Don't play dumb with me! Quit teaching\nLaxi all of your weird nonsense!
If you can't find the cast, then the play is\nfinished and you must simply accept it!

You must stop being such a child about
this. This play is the reason your illness is
acting up, so let it go, get some rest,
and move on to the next one!
You damn, stubborn fool! Why not?!
...Because it's my sister's dream to see it.

Shelley. She is the only family I have,
and she has the same illness as me.
She's been hospitalized for a year now,
and it is her dream to see this play.

This script is based on a story I told her.
She was starry-eyed when she heard it,
and said she'd love to see it performed in
all its glory.

People always tell me that art can't save
lives—that it should be the first thing
jettisoned from one's life during times
of strife or emergency.

But I disagree. Stories have the power to
change people. Give them hope. They can
serve as a moral compass, an inspiration,
and so much more.

If I show my sister this story, perhaps it
will bring the light to her eyes once more.
And if I have to cry like a child to make it
happen, that is exactly what I will do!
This is all just an act to convince me,\nisn't it? Just like you had Laxi do.
Of course not. I'm not an actor.
Marley, we must talk about the set.\n▷Huh? What are you doing here, Sylas?◁
He did not accept the role, did he?
No, but it's all right. If he doesn't accept,\nI'll just find a different actor who will.\nThis play WILL go on!
Hello, Laxi. I take it Marley sent you\nto bother me again?
Negative. Marley has gone searching for\nother performers, so I have not received\nany orders to act.
...You're crafting an aromatic now, right?\nI want to ask you something.
What does it feel like to make something?
Hmm? Where is this coming from?
I've never created anything, so I don't\nknow what a creator thinks when they\nbring something to life.
Which means I also don't know what our\ncreator, Maestro, was thinking.\nI've spent 300 years not knowing.
But when I read Marley's play and felt\nits heart, it gave me an idea.
I thought that if I figured out a way to help\nMarley make this heart complete, I might\ncome to understand Maestro better.
So that's why you accepted the role.
Affirmative. You and Marley are both\ncreating something, just like Maestro.\nNow please, tell me what it feels like.
You think Maestro and I are the same...?
Hmm, well, when I create aromatics...
Greetings, Sylas. You're quite late today.
My apologies. I stopped by the hospital\nin town before coming here.
What?\nOh... Were you checking to see if the tale\nabout my sister was all a pack of lies?
That was part of it. But it seems my\nsuspicions were unfounded. I wasn't even\nallowed to visit her in her state.
And do you feel better now that you've\nseen the truth for yourself?
Yes, and my apologies for having doubted\nyou. But that also wasn't the entire reason\nI went to the hospital.
You said your sister has the same illness\nas you.
As such, I thought perhaps she could make\nuse of my healing aromatics.
You brought aromatic herbs to\nthe hospital...?
I did. It shouldn't affect the rest of her\ntreatment, so I asked the nurses to use\nthem in her room.
Sylvan herbs work exceptionally well on\nsevere illnesses, and I thought they might\nbe some help with hers as well.
But those herbs are sylvan treasures!\nYou just GAVE them away?!
The cost is no issue. What matters is that\nI started to better understand where you\nwere coming from after hearing you out.
I understand what it's like to struggle with\nall your might to see someone you love\nmade whole again.
I know how hard that can be—\nand how desperate it can make you.\nWe are the same in this.
Ever since my grandfather died, I've spent\nevery day struggling, dreaming of the day\nthe grief will finally pass.
Perhaps we're more alike than we thought.
Perhaps we are. And that is why I want to\nhelp finish what you have begun.
I accept your offer to be in your play,\nso long as you agree to teach me how\none ＂acts.＂
I'd rather not repeat myself—we have\nmuch to do and very little time.
If we are going to brighten your sister's\nspirits, we must do whatever it takes to\nmake this play happen.
